Topic.Title: When will the hispanic community realize what just happened?

Message.Msg: And then you have (as reported in the L.A. Times) the story about Cuauhtemoc Negrete: "City Terrace resident Cuauhtemoc Negrete said he was told: "You better blend in or you’re going to get hurt." The group eventually approached him, someone punched him in the head and another person stole his bicycle. …" "Shortly after the attack, Negrete broke down in tears and expressed his frustration over the violence." “Why does it always have to go down this road?” he told The Times on Monday night." "He said he felt he was targeted because he was Latino. Others in the crowd said they saw similar incidents." I rest my case: Not only was George Zimmerman (a registered democrat and Hispanic) thrown under the bus by his own party, the left, and the MSM, but now it turns out (at least in L.A.) that any Hispanic man can and will receive the retribution of the racist mobs of the left, if (as Mr. Negrete was advised) he doesn't "blend in". Again, to my Latino and Latina brothers and sisters be very careful out there, because at least from the perspective of Mr. Negrete, you have a target on your backs and you will be made to pay the price for not "blending in". "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg
"..i think i will stop bothering with you ....fool..." Again? I don't think you can resist - you learn too much from my posts.....dick.

Topic.Title: When will the hispanic community realize what just happened?

Message.Msg: As I learned in the Military, especially my tour in Germany (66/67) there were a good many hispanics/latinos enlisted, to earn their U.S.citizenship. This is where I first learned & realized a tension and a predjudice towards Hispanic/Latino's. Trust me .. I had my problem with those that out-ranked me there. In Viet Nam I also had a few problems .. especially when MLK was assinated - And today we have a King 'AND' his Squire - of this same mind-set, that show "support" to encourage this racist behavior - with our Tax dollors & by "decree" !! So .. B O backs off .. and says to the public "THE JURY HAS SPOKEN", then sends his AG out to (willingly) do the 'dirty work' of their own prejudices - his words don't match his facial expressions, and that's called "body-language" .. something you can't hide - FACT I've always been color-blind ... even as an inner-city youngster .. till I get intentionally smacked in the face by these DOLTS playing their "race cards" - (I'm fully awake now, SMILES)

Martin stalked Zimmerman. According to Rachel Jeantel she told Martin that Zimmerman was possibly a #$%$ who might rape him so Martin coaxed him out of his vehicle by circling it then lured Zimmerman to an area where he could sucker punch him from behind which he did then began beating him
All gone...as always. $39 like a lifetime ago. Sorry for the person that paid $39 - never to be seen again. Osso

Topic.Title: When will the hispanic community realize what just happened?

Message.Msg: I guess I will have to agree with you; in the United State choosing and self assigning your race and/or your ethnic/national background is a time honored tradition in this great country, and our history is filled with many citizens who have taken advantage of this tradition, for example: o For many years a young man went by the name Jerry Rivers, because of the racism and bigotry that existed within the community where he spent most of his early years. It was only after society changed its sentiment was he able to resume the family name of his father. o In the case of Elizabeth Warren it became convenient for professional purposes to assume a Native American identity. o And finally in the case of our "dear leader" for many years both during his scholastic career and for many years after to self identify himself as a foreign exchange student and in the case of his literary career (according to the brochure published by his literary agent) he self identified his foreign origins. Yes self selecting your race and national origin is a time honored tradition and IMHO should be continued. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

Topic.Title: Immigrant Gains and Native Losses In the Job Market, 2000 to 2013

Message.Msg: Where did you get the story that someone punched someone and then killed them? The puncher apparently is the one that got killed. Unless you were there and witnessed the incident, you have no idea what really happened. The process was followed and the results are in...accept it. If it had been the reverse you would be praising the very same system. You're a hypocrite, through and through.

Topic.Title: When will the hispanic community realize what just happened?

Message.Msg: Theunit I was in had few Blacks. I shared a shelter half with one who was pretty decent. I heard of others that were not. There was a shootout in the Pusan red light district early in the Korean War. Most have never heard of it. Blacks started it and shot it out with thre MP's. About 60-70 died there. Early in the war everyone carried arms as there were so many No. Korean infiltrators.
You can't appeal an acquital. Basic law.

Again, kj, were your there? If not crawl back into our hole. Witnesses had their way. The jury heard the testimony and made a decision. I don't know about black people, but when someone is following you and you don't know if they are armed or not, it is not a good plan to confront them. It is in fact quite stupid. It also appears from the witnesses that Martin was very aggressive and was not defending himself as the weapon had not been shown yet. According to his girlfriend, he was just going to 'put some whoopass on him to chase away a homosexual. But that isn't prejudiced I guess. The only time on recorded record that Zimmerman even mentioned he was black, was after the 911 operator ask him if he was black, white or what he looked like. Of course Martin calling him a 'cracka' was racist either in your book? Unless you have film of the event, why not just shut up!

Now you're learning. If you are punched first, then it would be self-defense. What if you're punched more than once? What if the puncher is on top of you? What if you don't have a clue what your talking about?

"Led to a conflict?" He walked back to his truck and Martin followed him and assaulted him. There was no confrontation 'til then. He followed initially to get in front of the apartments to get an address to give to police. Do you pay ANY attention to what went on during trial?

And I am legally entitled to have it and to share it with anyone I choose. As long as I am not guilty of liable or slander, you have no recourse but to ignore me, as I plan to do with you and your opinion.
"We don't always get the truth from the media." You win first prize for the understatement of the year.

Why pay attention to the trial or witnesses? If they don't support the outcome you desire, they are all liars and racists. It is easier to make your desired result, then complain when you don't get it, being right or wrong has little if anything to do with it; you must get what you want or it is wrong!

Did anyone state that you did not have the right to your opinion??? NO. Is your opinion based on fact? In my opinion, which I also have the right to have...No. Prove what you say is true, or even partly true. Bet you can't. So your opinion is just that. In my opinion.............

Message.Title: Zimm Prosecutors (Reuters: July 16th)
Message.Msg: .. Zimm Prosecuters to face Lawsuit from fired Fla. State Attorneys Office Emp .. YEP, and this goes REAL DEEP !! Seems that Ben Kruidos, the former director of Angela Cory's "Info.Technology" office was fired after testifing at a pre-trial hearing. He had extracted potentially damaging prosecution info from Martin's cell phone, that the PROSECUTION was "legally obligated" to SHARE the with Zimmerman's Defense Team - info that the Judge would not allow either .. as requsted by Zimm's defense !! ... (the photos, texts, etc) All of this cell phone info was reported .. then swept under the rug, then Ben was fired for revealing it to 'other superiors/officials'. Ben has filed a "WhistleBlowers Lawsuit" against Angela Cory's Fla. State Attorney's Office Ben's Lawyer is 'another attorney' that was fired by Angela Cory's Fla. State Attorneys Office ... This Reuters article has quite a few twist & turns that will bring down a lot of unscrupulus people involved in this trial .. and may extend further ?? AND Zimm is found "NOT GUILTY" .. which really shows this was a malicious political 'Witch Hunt" .. (from our POTUS, and illiminating "this excuse" for anymore leftist anti-gun fodder) . Titled ... "Zimmerman Prosecutors To Face Whistleblower Lawsuit From Fired Fla. State Attorney Employee" .... New York, July 16th - (Reuters) It'll make you laugh with disgust .. their jig is up and we'll see what MSM's will dare carry this story ??
